page.title: 18RECREATION (East Block)
page.content: The{City School sports area}is in sq. 9569. We have completed a survey to find out how many children use it. The most popular sports were swimming, junior activities,roller skating and gymnastics. Activities which children would lke to see at the area were fencing,shooting, go-carting and ice-skating. Most people used the cafeteria or bar facilities after taking part in sport. In sq. 9571 there is the{Carholme golf {and race course.}From 1849 to 1964 the {Lincolnshire Handicap}race was run here. Three race meetings are held every spring. The stand holds about 2500 people and it has a bar and club room too. The golf club is in the same square as the race course, it was established in 1906 and there are about 500 members. The club house is not in our square.
